thread.title: Area Roundup 10-22-15: Sultana girls tennis team tops Apple Valley in tiebreaker
thread.title_full: Area Roundup 10-22-15: Sultana girls tennis team tops Apple Valley in tiebreaker

author: Staff Reports
title: Area Roundup 10-22-15: Sultana girls tennis team tops Apple Valley in tiebreaker
text: Posted Oct. 22, 2015 at 12:01 AM Updated at 10:35 PM Posted Oct. 22, 2015 at 12:01 AM Updated at 10:35 PM » Social News HESPERIA — Sultana girls tennis beat Apple Valley in a thriller on Thursday, outlasting the Sun Devils 84-81 in games after tying in sets 9-9. Most of Sultana’s success game in singles play, as they won six out nine. Neydi Vargas earned two wins 6-2, 7-6 (2), Autumn Johnson won 7-5, 6-1 and sister Lauren Johnson also won two sets by scores of 7-5, 6-1. The Sun Devils evened things up in doubles play, but Sultana held the edge in games at the end of the match. Sultana (3-14 MRL) hosts Burroughs on Tuesday. Apple Valley Singles Corey 6-2, 6-3, 7-5; Sanchez 2-6, 5-7, 5-7; Hathaway 6-7 (2), 1-6, 1-6. Apple Valley Doubles Webb-Conrad 6-1, 6-3, 6-0; Acosta-Fernandez 2-6, 6-4, 4-6; Duran-Aguilar 0-6, 6-3; Stine-Gregorian 7-6 (4). Sultana Singles Vargas 2-6, 6-2, 7-6 (2); A. Johnson 3-6, 7-5, 6-1; L. Johnson 5-7, 7-5, 6-1. Sultana Doubles C. Williams-McDonald 1-6, 6-2, 6-0; Baker-D. Williams 3-6, 4-6, 6-7 (4); Faris-Gomez 0-6, 6-4, 3-6. Prep Girls Tennis Oak Hills 14, Hesperia 4 At Oak Hills, the Bulldogs guaranteed a better-than-.500 record in Mojave River League play with a win over the Scorpions. Oak Hills (11-6, 8-6 MRL) wraps up league play at Apple Valley on Tuesday. Hesperia Singles M. Smith 2-6, 6-7 (2), 6-2; C. Smith 7-6 (0), 4-6, 5-7; Sanchez 6-3, 0-6, 3-6. Hesperia Doubles Aguilar-Connolly 1-6, 2-6, 6-1; Chum-Ruvalcaba 2-6, 4-6, 0-6; Medina-Garcia 1-6, 2-6, 1-6. Oak Hills Singles K. Heredia 6-2, 6-0, 7-5; Moreno 6-7 (0); Paige 7-6 (2), 6-3; McMahon 3-6, 6-4; Gonzalez 2-6. Oak Hills Doubles Smith-Torres 6-1, 6-2, 6-0; Evans-Bronson 6-2, 6-2; Evans-B. Heredia 6-1; Brar-Akoh 6-1, 6-4; Hill-Hubbard 1-6. Granite Hills 13, Barstow 5 At Apple Valley, the Cougars knocked off Barstow in a Desert Sky League match. Barstow only took three singles games off of the Cougars. Audrey Stewart and Nikhol Pluta each bageled in their wins. Granite Hills (11-1, 10-0 DSL) plays at Victor Valley on Monday before wrapping up league play on Tuesday against Silverado. Barstow Singles O’Neal 0-6, 0-6, 2-6; Yost 0-6, 0-6, 1-6; Jancilan 0-6, 0-6; Valdovinos 0-6. Barstow Doubles Jordan-Godfrey 6-1, 6-0, 6-1; Halsey-Becerra 3-6, 6-3, 6-2; Crane-Palidini 1-6, 5-7; Crane-Fields 5-7. Granite Hills Singles Stewart 6-0, 6-0, 6-0; Pluta 6-0, 6-0, 6-0; Mehta 6-2, 6-1, 6-0. Granite Hills Doubles O’Kelly-Garcia 1-6, 6-3, 6-1; Torres-Bambhania 0-6, 3-6; Donado-Andraee 7-5; Moorehead-Koppel 1-6, 2-6, 7-5. Serrano 14, Burroughs 4 At Ridgecrest, the Diamondbacks clinched another league title with a comfortable win over the Burros on Thursday. Madeline Cortez, Aliyah Ellis and Jessie Kim all swept in singles play while Lacey Slocumb and Kaya Ellis led the way for Serrano in doubles. Serrano (20-0, 14-0 MRL) plays at Hesperia on Tuesday. Serrano Singles Cortez 6-0, 6-0, 6-0; A. Ellis 6-1, 6-0, 6-0; Kim 6-0, 6-1, 6-1. Serrano Doubles Slocumb-K. Ellis 6-1, 6-3, 6-4; Tarver-Windward 3-6, 7-6 (1), 6-0; Evans-Tran 5-7, 4-6; Olson-Tran 0-6. Burroughs Singles H. Weik 0-6, 1-6, 0-6; Koch 0-6, 0-6, 1-6; J. Weik 0-6, 0-6, 1-6. Burroughs Doubles Cook-Osterman 1-6, 6-4, 0-6; Aralar-Mower 3-6, 6-3, 6-0; McGrew-Kolar 4-6, 6-7 (1), 7-5. Silverado 16, Victor Valley 2 At Victorville, the Hawks doubles teams of Tiffany Williams and Taylor Fox, and Raylene Ziranda and Jackie Garcia each swept in Silverado final home match of the regular season. Williams and Fox won 6-2, 6-3, 7-5 while Ziranda and Garcia went 6-1, 6-3, 7-6 (7). Victor Valley forfeited its No. 3 singles spot and it’s No. 1 singles player had to retire after her first set. Silverado (10-7, 7-4 Desert Sky League) travels to play first-place Granite Hills on Tuesday. Victor Valley Singles Aye 6-1, 0-1 retired, 0-1 retired; Shirley 2-6, 1-6, 0-6; 0-1 default, 0-1 default, 0-1 default. Victor Valley Doubles Gomez-Valvadines 1-6, 5-7, 6-7 (7); Rivera-Arreaga 7-6 (5), 2-6, 3-6; Revis-Rodriguez 1-6, 3-6, 1-6. Silverado Singles Reyes 1-6; Bagnol 0-1 default; Cox 6-2; Panitan 6-1, 0-1 default, 0-1 default; Navarro 1-0 default; Abdulfattah 6-0, 1-0 retired. Silverado Doubles Ford-Carrillo 6-1, 6-1; Castro-Ford 6-7 (5); Williams-Fox 6-2, 6-3, 7-5; Ziranda-Garcia 6-1, 6-3, 7-6 (7). Prep Boys Volleyball Apple Valley Christian 3, Bethel Christian Riverside 2 At Riverside, the Warriors fell in the first and fourth sets but pulled out a win. They lost 14-25, won 25-19 and 25-18, lost 19-25 and then won 15-4. Zach Richart notched 18 kills, nine assists and two aces; Noah Leslie posted 15 kills, nine assists and three aces; and Alex Richart added five kills and three aces. Apple Valley Christian (3-9 AL) begins its postseason tournament against Bethel Christian Riverside next week. Prep Girls Volleyball Granite Hills 3, Victor Valley 0 At Victorville, the Cougars swept the Jackrabbits 25-23, 25-19, 25-20. Leah Wiggington posted nine kills and 12 digs; Alicia Christensen notched seven kills; Lauren Wilson added seven kills; Kacy Hele contributed 19 assists, 15 digs and a pair of kills; Jaclyn Ranow had 14 digs. Emily Vadillo posted 14 digs and nine kills for Victor Valley; Kamara Haile notched 10 digs, four blocks, eight kills and a pair of aces; Kristen DeLaTorre added 12 digs; Mady Chavez had eight digs and 25 assists; and Damara Haile contributed five digs and three kills. Victor Valley (5-4 DSL) plays at Adelanto on Tuesday. Granite Hills (10-0 DSL) hosts Barstow on Thursday. Silverado 3, Adelanto 1 At Victorville, Kyndra Jordan led the Hawks to a four-set victory at home with 17 kills, 11 digs and three aces. Silverado beat the Saints 25-22, 22-25, 25-22, 25-20. Mary Flores added 30 assists, 30 digs and four kills for the Hawks. Destiny Marshall contributed 20 digs and eight kills and Kendall Conner added 27 digs and two aces. Silverado (5-4 DSL) hosts Barstow on Tuesday for senior night. Lucerne Valley 3, Apple Valley Christian 0 At Apple Valley, the Mustangs swept the Warriors 25-19, 25-8, 25-18. Shaylie McCloud had seven aces, five kills, four digs and two blocks for Apple Valley Christian. Brina Spidle added 10 digs, six assists, two kills and one ace. AVCS (4-10, 4-3 AL) travels to play Antelope Valley Christian on Tuesday. Hesperia Christian 3, Bethel Christian Lancaster 0 At Lancaster, the Patriots won 25-20, 25-5 and 25-14 in an Agape League match. For Hesperia Christian, Ashley Woods had five digs; Brooke Johnson posted five digs and 10 assists; Kayli Klasa notched five digs, 10 assists and six kills; Mia Williams added five digs, 10 aces, seven kills and 17 points. Hesperia Christian (10-4, 6-1 Agape league) hosts Victor Valley Christian on Tuesday. Riverside Prep 3, ACE 0 At Oro Grande, the Silver Knights swept in a Cross Valley League match. Riverside Prep won 25-16, 25-12 and 25-20. Breanna Pedrin posted nine kills for the Silver Knights, while Tatiana Barajas and Kendal Clark-Davis had five kills each. Riverside Prep finished with 28 kills on the night. Kaylynn Glaser notched four blocks and three kills. Savannah Johnson and Stephanie McDowell earned 10 assists apiece. Julie Molina notched an ace and four kills for ACE; Gaby Gonzalez had an ace and two kills; Anna Menough picked up four kills; Ariel Spelling had three kills; Priscilla Fuentes added an ace and a kill. Riverside Prep (9-9-2, 4-6 CVL) hosts Lutheran on Tuesday. ACE (3-11, 0-9 CVL) hosts AAE on Tuesday. Victor Valley Christian wins in forfeit At Victorville, the Royals won in a forfeit over Antelope Valley Christian 25-0, 25-0, 25-0. Victor Valley Christian (2-7, 2-5 AL) plays at Bethel Christian Lancaster on Monday. Prep Boys Water Polo Fontana 12, Granite Hills 7 At Fontana, the Cougars dropped their penultimate game to cement a second place finish in the San Andreas League. A win would have moved Granite Hills into a tie for first place. They lost to Fontana 10-8 in their first meeting and beat them 10-9 in their second. Garrett Tomlin and Connor Garcia each scored a pair of goals. Wiley Munson and Anthony Nassar made a pair of saves each. The Cougars (11-6, 6-3 SAL) hosts San Gorgonio to close out the regular season on Tuesday. Granite Hills 0 1 3 3 — 7 Fontana 2 3 5 2 — 12 Granite Hills (7) Tomlin 2, Garcia 2, Cooper 1, Nassar 1, Smith 1; Saves — Munson 2, Nassar 2. Fontana (12) Lerma 6, Mejia 2, Vazquez 1, Rofalef 1, Vasquez 1, Cabrai 1; Saves — Pelayo 6. By Staff Reports
